_header: Sith cursed death hath taken my mistress
Title(s): Reflections on the death of his Mistress
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, Reflections on the death of his Mistress, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, l29) — three 9-line stanzas and 6-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
SYn cursid deth hath taken my maystresWhich y most louyd as satt
                    me well trewly…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…And as for my last wille this bill be sentTo alle that trewly
                    loue where so they are
